What is the purpose of a Project Charter, as discussed in the Bloody Mary example?

The purpose of a Project Charter, as discussed in the Bloody Mary example, is to provide a clear and concise overview of the project's objectives, scope, stakeholders, and key deliverables. It serves as a foundational document that outlines the project's direction, goals, and constraints, helping to ensure alignment and understanding among all team members and stakeholders.
